name: Research
summary: Explorations

choices.name: Use effective research methods for your Dutch ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Basics: Learn the basics of Netherlands research in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Research in the Netherlands
    ☆ RT—Going Dutch: Finding Families in Online Records of the Netherlands - 2019

  2. Get an overview of Dutch family history on the Archives.com site.

    ☆ AR—Dutch Family History

  3. Town of Origin: Learn how to find the town of origin for Dutch ancestors.

    ☆ FS—Netherlands Research With the Wiki Part 2 of 7: The Netherlands Finding Town of Origin—6:18

  4. Resources: Explore genealogy in the Netherlands.

    ☆ LT—4 Pro Tips for Finding Dutch Family History Resources
    ☆ OT—Dutch Genealogy

  5. Explore ☆Your Guide to Finding Ancestors from Netherlands by Barb Snow.
  6. Learn more about Dutch research in the ☆Dutch Genealogy blog site.
  7. Explore a variety of records on the ☆FreeDutchAncestry site.
Records
  1. Record Finder: Use the Netherlands Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Netherlands Record Finder

  2. Forebears.io: Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.
  3. Pre-1811: Learn how to do Dutch research before 1811.

    ☆ FS—Dutch Research before 1811—59:08 - 2017

choices.name: Get started with the Dutch language for research.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for language resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Language and Terms: Learn more about the Dutch language for research.

    ☆ FS—Netherlands Languages
    ☆ AC—Dutch Genealogy Terms

  2. Learn how to pronounce Dutch words in your research.

    ☆ FS—Beginner Dutch Handwriting, Quirks: Dutch Spelling—5:10 - 2019

  3. Learn how to pronounce Dutch words, to help with spelling variations.

    ☆ FS—Beginner Dutch Handwriting, Quirks: Dutch Pronunciation—13:44 - 2020

Reading Records
  1. Skills: Improve your skills in researching Dutch records.

    ☆ AC—Researching Dutch-Language Records

  2. Learn more about reading Dutch records in these videos.

    ☆ FS—Netherlands Research With the Wiki Part 4 of 7: Reading Dutch Records—5:50
    ☆ FS—Intro to Reading Dutch Records: Part 1—32:42 - 2019

  3. Get additional practice reading Dutch church records.

    ☆ FS—Intro to Reading Dutch Records: Part 2—42:07 - 2019

  4. Early Records: Learn how to read early Dutch church records in this blog from Olive Tree Genealogy.

    ☆ OT—Help Reading 17th-Century Dutch Church Records - 2017

choices.name: Learn about Dutch names and surnames for research.

content.text:
1. Get an introduction to Dutch names in this video.

    ☆ FS—Dutch Patronymics—8:27

  2. Naming Patterns: Learn about Dutch naming patterns. See also this Ancestry article on Dutch first names.
  3. Surnames: Here is a guide to understanding Dutch surnames.

    ☆ LT—Windmills, Tulips, and Wooden Shoes: A Guide to Dutch Surnames

  4. Explore this Dutch surname database.
  5. Learn about Dutch patronymics in this Olive Tree article.

    ☆ OT—Dutch Patronymics

  6. Learn about the origin and meaning of Dutch surnames.

    ☆ AF—The Origin and Meaning of Your Dutch Surname—7:55 - 2019



  7. Search the ☆Geneanet site for Dutch surnames.
  8. Search for Dutch surnames in a number of databases.

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Learn about Netherlands archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Netherlands Archives and Libraries  
    • National Archive
    • Church Archives
    • Historical and Genealogical Societies

  2. Provinces: Learn about online records from province archives.

    ☆ FS—Netherlands Research With the Wiki Part 6 of 7: Online Province Archives, Local Indexes—4:27

  3. Portal: Explore the ☆Archives Portal Europe site. Click the Directories link and then select Netherlands.
  4. Books We Own: Explore the ☆Books We Own site for books that can be checked out or researched for you by others.

choices.name: Use the OpenArch site for research.

content.text:
1. Learn about OpenArch indexed records.

    ☆ FS—OpenArch.nl Website: Indexed Records for the Netherlands Record Types—3:40 - 2018

  2. Search: Learn about search tips for OpenArch.

    ☆ FS—OpenArch.nl Website: Indexed Records for the Netherlands Search Tips—5:24 - 2018

  3. Solve a sample research problem using OpenArch.

    ☆ FS—OpenArch.nl Website: Indexed Records for the Netherlands Research Problem Walkthrough—18:02 - 2018

  4. Explore the OpenArch site to do archive research for Dutch names.
  5. Explore Dutch archives on this site.

choices.name: Explore Netherlands emigration and immigration.

content.text:
1. Sites: Explore Dutch immigration to the U.S. and Canada on the Olive Tree Genealogy site.
  2. Study records for 17-century Dutch immigrants on this site.
  3. Explore additional Dutch emigration websites.
  4. Explore the Immigrant Ancestors site from Brigham Young University.
  5. Explore the ☆Immigrant Ship site. Select a Volume, then choose Netherlands as the departure or arrival location.

content.text:
1. Find links to ☆Dutch newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Search Dutch newspapers in the ☆onlinenewspapers.com site.
  3. Search Dutch newspapers in the ☆world-newspapers.com site.
  4. Search Dutch newspapers in the ☆ABYZ News Links site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Dutch research.

content.text:
1. Explore links in the FamilySearch Wiki.
  2. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore ☆Netherlands websites in FamilySearch for research.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for the Netherlands.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the FamilySearch page for Dutch online record collections.
  4. Explore the Europe page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Netherlands research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Dutch Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Central Europe Genealogical Research Community page on Facebook.
  3. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Netherlands.

choices.name: Join a mailing list, community, or message board for Netherlands research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for Netherlands research.
  2. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Netherlands research.
  3. Explore the ☆Netherlands research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Netherlands research.
